chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent (2nd+ offense)

result.execSummary:
The defendant John Emilio Castro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. No contact direct or indirect with K.S. and D.S.

superTimeConds.notes: To perform  20  hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency per year of extended supervision.

records.addlTxt: 9:42 AM Defendant John Emilio Castro in court, in custody.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for John Emilio Castro.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct.1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct.1. Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. State/defense join in recommendation, make statements. Defendant makes statement. Court makes statement, imposes sentence.  Bond no longer in effect.

Bond remains in effect.
